fullDescription.intro: This node identifies duplicate rows. Duplicate rows have identical values in certain columns. The node chooses a single row for each set of duplicates ("chosen"). You can either remove all duplicate rows from the input table and keep only unique and chosen rows or mark the rows with additional information about their duplication status.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Allows the selection of columns identifying the duplicates. Columns not selected are handled under "Row selection" in the "Advanced" tab.

tab.name: Duplicate Rows
tab.option: Advanced setting that removes duplicate rows and keeps only unique and chosen rows.

Advanced setting that appends columns with additional information to the input table:
Add column showing the row status ('unique', 'chosen', 'duplicate') to all rows: Appends a column with the row status:
unique: There is no other row with the same values in the selected columns.
chosen: This row was chosen from a set of duplicate rows.
duplicate: This row is a duplicate and represented by another row.
Add column identifying the RowID: Appends a column with the RowID of the chosen row for duplicate rows. Unique and chosen rows will not have a RowID assigned.

option.name: Row chosen in case of duplicate

tab.option:
Advanced setting that defines which row for each set of duplicates is selected:
First:The first row in sequence is chosen.
Last:The last row in sequence is chosen.
Minimum of:The first row with the minimum value in the selected column is chosen. In case of strings, the row will be chosen following lexicographical order. Missing values are sorted after the maximum value.
Maximum of:The first row with the maximum value in the selected column is chosen. In case of strings, the row will be chosen following lexicographical order. Missing values are sorted before the minimum value.

tab.name: Additional options
tab.option: Advanced setting that, if selected, speeds up computation by utilizing working memory (RAM). The amount of required memory is higher than for a regular computation and also depends on the amount of input data.
Advanced setting that, if selected, ensures that the rows in the output table are in the same order as in the input table.
Advanced setting to enable recomputation of the domain of all columns in the output table such that the domain's bounds exactly match the bounds of the data in the output table.

ports.inPort: The data table containing potential duplicates.
ports.outPort: Either the input data without duplicates or the input data with additional columns identifying duplicates.
